definitions.text:
Tarry
1. To stay; to abide; to continue; to lodge.Tarry all night and wash your feet. Genesis 19:2.
2. To stay behind. Exodus 12:39.
3. To stay expectation; to wait.Tarry ye here for till we come again to you. Exodus 24:14.
4. To delay; to put off going or coming; to defer.Come down to me, tarry not. Genesis 45:9.
5. To remain; to stay.He that telleth lies, shall not tarry my sight. Psalms 101:7.TAR'RY,
To wait for.I cannot tarry dinner. [Not use.]T'ARRY,
